INGREDIENTS:

 • 80 grams butter, softened
 • 3/4 cup unrefined sugar + 2 teaspoons for sprinkling on top
 • 3/4 cup whole wheat flour
 • 3/4 cup all-purpose flour
 • 1-1/2 teaspoon baking powder
 • 1 egg (or flaxmeal egg replacer) 
 • 1/2 cup milk
 • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
 • 450 grams strawberries, halved

 METHOD: 
 1. To begin making the 50% Whole-Wheat Strawberry Tea Cake Recipe, we will first begin by pre-heating the oven at 180° C and preparing the baking dish by buttering and flouring it (this cake rises a fair bit, so ensure the pan is deep enough) 
 2. In a small mixing bowl, sift together the flours and the baking powder
 3. Using a stand mixer or hand mixer, beat the softened butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Gradually break in the egg orflaxmeal egg replacer, add milk and vanilla extract and beat it into the butter sugar mixture until just combined
 4. Gradually add the flour mixture and beat until all the flour is well combined to make a smooth cake batter. Take care not to over mix. 
 5. Spoon the batter into the prepared baking tin and place the halved strawberries on top with the cut side down in a single layer. Sprinkle the 2 teaspoons of sugar and bake the Strawberry Cake for about 30 minutes or until the cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the centre comes out clean (however, molten strawberries may be gooey). 
 6. Once the cake is baked, remove from the oven and allow it to rest for about 10 minutes before you are ready to serve them.
